info.name: Devin Villarosa
info.title: Software Engineer
info.notes: This site was created using React and Create-React-App. Visit and follow my github if you wish to reference or copy this template

about: 3 year software engineer with a taste in various software flavors. From embedded systems, fullstack web development, tools, infrastructure, automation, and testing. Currently exploring AWS and serverless applications with automation. I would like to help current students move their systems to the cloud to manifest their ideas to the public.

work.summary: Transitioning on premise system onto AWS.

Implemented team's tools and CI/CD workflow. Managed entire repository's code merges and build system. Lead engineer in implementing capabilities for program. Trained team in using Test-Driven development using GoogleTest and Git

Development in new RADAR IRAD. Implemented messages for system to communicate to FPGA. Documented the team's process by booting up and managing an internal Wiki. Implemented automated testing framework using cppUnit and LTTNG to automate testing for timing certain routines

Developed automation tools for software team to keep track of processing lidar data. Used RESTful API implementation to update database and pulling data. Data processing scripts will pull appropriate data and call API URL endpoints to update the database. Coordinated with cross-functional teams to update UI/UX to be more responsive and easier to understand.
Fast-paced early startup member. Helped getting MVP out for IOT product focused on kid watches.

projects.name: Serverless Dropbox
projects.description: Leverages AWS S3, Route53, Cloudfront, Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB to download class notes materials all together

projects.name: Weight-Lifting WebApp
projects.description: Utilizies Djano Rest Framework API calls to keep track of user's lifts and workouts history. Fast deployment with AWS Elastic Beanstalk

projects.name: Self-driving RC Car
projects.description: Self-driving RC car composed of 6 microcontrollers, communicating with each other using CAN bus. Composed of a 10 person team. In charge of I/O submodule

projects.name: NFC Locker
projects.description: Simple locker using locking mechanism activated by NFC Phone application

projects.name: Self-balancing Quadcopter
projects.description: Self-balancing quadcopter utilizng simple Kalman filtering from IMU device
